Panel.style: margin-bottom: 0px; vertical-align: bottom; horizontal-align: right; margin-right: 63.5%; background-color: #101010; border-style: solid; border-color: grey; border-width: 2px; min-width: 200px;

Label.text: Artifact Items can be acquired from Bosses, Mobs and Quests, like normal Items.
They exist in Epic, Legendary, Immortal and [Ancient] Immortal Item quality.
Special Artifact Traits, Path Bonuses and Rune Words can roll on Artifacts of Immortal or better quality.
Increase all Ability Damage that is of type Fire and is against enemies below 50% of max Health by a percentage.
Increase the max stack count of stack based debuffs by a percentage.
When you cause Single Target Healing that is not over time, you place a Divine Shield on the target, absorbing Damage equal to a percentage of Healing done, not stacking, capped at 100% of max HP.
The first Ability Damage instance you deal to an enemy will deal increased Damage.
When you deal Frost Damage to an enemy, there is a 25% chance to increase the Damage by a percentage and stun them in a Block of Ice for 3 secs. Frostbite can affect each enemy only once.
All Critical Strike Chances are increased by a percentage for Damage instances that are Physical Damage over Time.
Gain a Bonus to Cast and Attack range as well as half of that Bonus to Spellpower.
Auto Attacks have a chance to cause an Auto Attack on all other enemies within 250 yards around the original target.
When you are not landing a Critical Strike, your Healing and Ability Damage when dealing Nature Damage is increased by a percentage.
The first Debuff you apply to an enemy will last longer.
All Ability Damage has a chance to also affect all other enemies within 250 yards of the original target.
When you deal Arcane Damage, Pure Damage and a Critical Strike in the same Damage instance, you gain a percentage Ability Damage Bonus for that Damage instance.
All Ability Damage instances that cause exactly two different Elemental Damage types, have their Damage increased by a percentage. Physical Damage is not considered Elemental Damage for Twin Blast.
Whenever you deal Damage with a Summon or Companion, restore a percentage of max Resource.
After having cast 25 Abilities, gain 10% Movement Speed and increase your Auto Attack Critical Strike Damage by a percentage for 5 secs.
Bonuses that increase your Strength by a percentage will now also affect your Armor by a portion of that percentage.
When you are being attacked, lower the attacker's Armor and Spell Resistance for 10 secs.
A portion of your % Healing Bonuses will now also affect your Damage output by a percentage.
Bonuses that increase your total Agility by a percentage are now more effective.
Damage all nearby enemies every sec for Fire Damage equal to a percentage of your Strength plus Agility.
Effects that reduce your total Damage taken by a percentage, now grant a portion of that as % Damage Bonus. Armor and Spell Resistance do not count as total Damage reduction effects.
Whenever you cast an Ability with a Cooldown of 30 secs or higher, increase your Primary Attribute by a percentage for 10 secs, stacking up to 5 times.
Ability Damage with a scaling of 500% or higher gains a Critical Strike Damage Bonus.
Bonuses that increase your max Health by a percentage will now also affect your Attack Damage by a portion of that percentage.
Bonuses that increase your max Mana by a percentage will now also affect your Spellpower by a portion of that percentage.
Gain Intellect based on a percentage of your Strength.
After dealing Chaos Damage, reduce the next Damage instance you take by a percentage.
After taking Damage, increase all Damage and Healing caused by a percentage for 8 secs.
Gain an Aura, increasing the Intellect of all allies. Stacks with other Players.
Add a percentage of your Attack Damage plus Spellpower as Base Damage to all Ability Damage instances that deal Shadow Damage.
Abilities with a cooldown of 30 or more seconds have a chance to reset their cooldown when cast, capped at 50%, with an inner cooldown of 300 secs.
Gain % Nature Damage equal to a percentage of your Strength.
Gain an Aura, increasing the Agility of all allies. Stacks with other Players.
When you cast an Ability that costs Resources, refund a flat amount of Resources (Mana or Energy).

While you have taken on a different Form, gain a % Elemental Damage Bonus for all Elements, including Physical. This includes Shadow Form, Aspect of the Crow, Storm Crow, Feralform, Demon Crash, Shape of Terror and Doomonology.
Abilities that have a resource cost of 30 or higher have their Damage and Healing increased by a percentage.
When you deal Holy Damage, Heal the most injured ally within 900 yards for a percentage of max Health, with an inner Cooldown of 10 secs.
Abilities that scale purely from Strength will now also scale from Agility, equal to a percentage of the original Strength scaling.
Frost Damage with a scaling of 500% or higher has a chance to Critical Strike for 500%.
Improves the cap at which Spellhaste affects the tick rate of Channeled Abilities by a percentage.
A percentage of your Bonus Attack Speed now also increases your Healing output by a percentage.
Increase all Damage by a percentage for 3 secs every 10 secs.
Gain an Aura, increasing the Strength of all allies. Stacks with other Players.
Gain % Fire Damage equal to a percentage of your Strength.
Gain % Frost Damage equal to a percentage of your Agility.
Gain % Holy Damage equal to a percentage of your Intellect.
Gain % Arcane Damage equal to a percentage of your % Mana and % Health Bonuses.
Gain % Shadow and % Physical Damage equal to a percentage of your Spell Resistance.
Gain % Chaos and % Physical Damage equal to a percentage of your Armor.
Gain % Nature Damage equal to a percentage of your Attack Speed.
These statistics are a snapshot, taken every 30 secs.
They are based on the last Ability Damage Instance\nyou caused right before the snapshot happens.
Cooldown Reduction considers the last Ability\ncast before the snapshot happens.

The default DotA stats are altered in Titanbreaker.
You can find details when hovering over your main stats UI.

Melee Heroes start with 30 Spell Resistance (not Healers)
+50 Health per Hero Level

There are 2 effects that modify the Damage of Abilities
on a percentage basis: % Damage and % Elemental
Damage(Fire, Frost, Arcane, Physical...). % Damage
from any sourcestacks multiplicatively,
while % Elemental Damage stacks additively.

Ability Damage can also be affected by non-percentage based
Elemental Damage. For example + 10 Fire Damage causes
each Fire Damage instance to add 10 Damage to its base
Damage, ignoring the scaling of the Ability but receiving
other Bonuses.
Effects that modify the Healing of Abilities\non a percentage basis stack additively.
Effects that modify Critical Strike Chances\nand Damage stack additively.
Spell Resistance from Artifacts is capped at 35.
Percentage Bonuses from multiple Artifacts\nstack additively (for example +5% Damage and\n+10% Damage results in +15% Damage).
Spellhaste increases the tick rate of Channeled Abilities\nbut only up to 200%.

When you have more than 1 core Healer (Divine Crusader /
Holy Cleric / Twilight Cleric / Peaceful Guardian / Spirit Voodoo)
in your party, there will be a Healing output penalty
for all players: 2 Healers = 25% Output, 3 Healers = 10% Output

Each Class has a different passive Bonus:
Brawler: + 10% increased Armor
Deathbringer: + 10% Strength
Crusader: + 10% Healing caused and received
Shadowstalker: +10% Pure Damage chance
Guardian: + 5% All Attributes
Demonslayer: + 25 Movement and Attack Speed
Shaolin: +15% Ability Crit Damage
Ranger: + 10% Agility
Voodoo: + 15 Spell Resistance
Wizard: + 10% Intellect
Witcher: + 10% max Mana and Health
Cleric: + 10% Mana Regeneration and Spellpower

Panel.style: horizontal-align: center; margin-top: 100px; width:75%; height:80%; flow-children:down;
flow-children: down; horizontal-align: center; overflow: scroll;

Label.style: vertical-align: center; color: white; font-size: 20px; margin-right: 10px;

Label.text: Crafting creates a random Item of the chosen Item Quality and Item Slot.
Crafting requires the Molten Forge to be cleared and as well as 5 Titans of your choice (merged Titans do not count) to be defeated on a certain Monster Level.
When you craft an Immortal Item, there is a 10% chance for it to be of [Ancient] Immortal Quality.
Act 12 and Act 13 reward Badges of Honor, which grant a 50% discount for the next Item you craft.
Rings and Amulets require Act 12, respectively Act 13, to be cleared. Gambling for a random slot does not include Rings and Amulets.
When purchasing, your hero will automatically and immediately be saved and the Gold will be gone! Make sure to save again after picking up your Item or it will be lost.
Path Points are gained whenever you level up,\nfrom level 15 onwards, every 2nd Level.
Path Talents are unlocked row by row, starting from the top.\nTo unlock a new row, you need to spend atleast 3 Path Points\nin that Path.
Path Talents are naturally capped at Level 3. With Bonuses from\nArtifacts, Souls and Divines, they can go up to Level 10.\nThere are no Bonuses for the last row.
When saving with this setting,\nyou keep your Path Points on next load.
Titanbreaker is a 5 player dungeon crawler RPG with permanent character saving and an emphasis on teamplay.
Each Hero has 5 lives at the beginning of the game, after which he will no longer be resurrected.
There are 13 Acts to defeat, each one being slightly harder than the previous.

After defeating an Act, you should go to the Titan Temple, using the Teleporter, and defeat the corresponding Titan there. Do this for all 10 Titans, after which\nyou must defeat the Final Boss in the Temple. After that, clear Act 12 and do the escort Quest at the end. Then clear Act 13.\nNow you have cleared all content, but you can still fight the remaining Bosses in the Mogushan Arena for extra Loot and Boss Kill Score.
You can increase the Monster Level at the start of the game, which makes enemies stronger but also rewards better loot and higher Boss Kill Score for the Leaderboard.

The more Bosses you kill in a single game, the better the drop chances for Items become, as incentive to beat as many Acts per run as possible. Also some rare items like [Singularities], which are the only Items that can be placed in the neutral Item slot, only drop after beating all 13 Acts [weak ones on Monster Level 20 or higher and strong ones on Monster Level 500 or higher].
Heroes in Titanbreaker usually fit into the category of Tank, Healer or DPS. Ideally you should have one Tank and one Healer in your group.
Heroes in Titanbreaker are highly customized and often use custom Mana Systems and Combo Points.
The standard Dota Shop is disabled in Titanbreaker.
You can use it to browse for Items, but you can not buy Items there.
Instead there is a Blacksmith (tab on the left), where you can buy Items up to Epic quality for Gold.
This Shop also sells recipes that are required to combine Item Sets.
Later in the game there also is the Molten Forge located in Act 8 (requires playing on Monster Level 10), where you can craft Artifacts for Gold.
Join our discord server if you need help or have questions: https://discord.gg/as8MzdJ.
Listed below are Special Quests that are very hard, but grant unique Hero specific loot.
At Monster Level 5 you will be rewarded with Legendary Items and at Monster Level 50 you will be rewarded with Ancient Immortal Items.
Clear Act 1 and Act 2 in less than 12 Minutes without your team losing a life.
Clear Act 3 and 4 without your team losing a life.
Clear Act 4 in less than 10 Minutes without your team losing a life.
Clear Act 5 and Act 6 without your team losing a life.
Clear Act 7 in less than 8 Minutes without your team losing a life.
Clear Act 8 without your team losing a life.
Clear Act 10 without your team losing a life.
Defeat the King of the Jungle in Act 12 with your team losing 3 lives at most.
Clear Act 13 with your team losing 5 lives at most.

Displayed below are the Immortal and [Ancient] Immortal Items that could have dropped from the last Monster that died. Each Item has an equal chance to drop.\nNote that [Ancient] Immortal Artifacts and Souls only have a low chance to appear in the Loot Table.
